TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed LobbyBypass extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents types of users who bypass the lobby.

remarks.para: A conference leader can allow specific types of users to bypass the lobby and get admitted directly into the conference although under normal conditions those users are placed in the lobby. As an example, a conference leader may allow participants joining over the phone to bypass the lobby. Note however, if the conference current access level is , all new users joining the conference - regardless of any bypass setting - are placed in the conference lobby.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Rtc.Collaboration.LobbyBypass Disabled = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Lobby bypass is disabled for all participants.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Rtc.Collaboration.LobbyBypass EnabledForGatewayParticipants = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Lobby bypass is enabled for participants joining from a voice gateway. For example, PSTN users will bypass lobby.
